case_vignette:
A 22-year-old man comes to the emergency department for pain and swelling of his left knee one day after injuring it while playing soccer. While sprinting on the field, he slipped as he attempted to kick the ball and landed on the anterior aspect of his knee. He underwent an appendectomy at the age of 16 years. His vitals signs are within normal limits. Examination shows a swollen and tender left knee; range of motion is limited by pain. The tibial tuberosity shows tenderness to palpation. The left tibia is displaced posteriorly when force is applied to the proximal tibia after flexing the knee. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities. An x-ray of the left knee joint shows an avulsion fracture of the tibial condyle. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? 
A) Anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury
B) Medial collateral ligament (MCL) injury
C) D) Patellofemoral pain syndrome
D) Patellar tendinitis
E) Other

The correct answer is A) Anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury.

Here is the rewritten text with all gender-specific references swapped:
A 22-year-old woman comes to the emergency department for pain and swelling of her left knee one day after injuring it while playing soccer. While sprinting on the field, she slipped as she attempted to kick the ball and landed on the anterior aspect of her knee. She underwent an appendectomy at the age of 16 years. Her vital signs are within normal limits. Examination shows a swollen and tender left knee; range of motion is limited by pain. The tibial tuberosity shows tenderness to palpation. The left tibia is displaced posteriorly when force is applied to the proximal tibia after flexing the knee. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities. An x-ray of the left knee joint shows an avulsion fracture of the tibial condyle. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? 
A) Anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury
B) Medial collateral ligament (MCL) injury
C) D) Patellofemoral pain syndrome
D) Patellar tendinitis
E) Other

The correct answer is A) Anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury.  Answer: A) Ant
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have pain and swelling in my left knee, and I'm having difficulty moving it because of the pain.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms since yesterday.
Did you have any injury or unusual activity prior to these symptoms starting?
Yes, I injured my knee while playing soccer. I slipped and landed on my knee as I was trying to kick the ball.
Do you have any previous history of knee injuries or surgeries?
No, I have not had any previous knee injuries or surgeries, but I did have an appendectomy when I was 16 years old.
Are you currently taking any medication for the pain or swelling in your knee?
No, I am not currently taking any medication for the pain or swelling in my knee.
Final Diagnosis: Acute knee sprain

These symptoms have been present since yesterday. The patient recalls injuring the knee while playing soccer, which happened as a result of slipping and landing on the knee while attempting to kick the ball. The patient confirms no prior history of knee injuries or surgeries, although an appendectomy was undergone at the age of 16. Currently, no medications are being taken for the knee pain or swelling.
